bt.Model

Class Bittorrent

  • java.lang.Object
    • bt.Model.Bittorrent

  • public class Bittorrent
extends java.lang.Object
    Bittorrent is the main class for the client. It will initialize the Tracker data fields in its constructor for then establishing a connection with it.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String clientID
      Randomly generated user ID.
      private java.net.Socket clientSocket
      Client socket to communicate with the tracker server.
      private byte[][] collection
      double array pieces collection
      private boolean[] completedPieces
      This array reads true if the piece at the index has been downloaded and verified, and false otherwise.
      (package private) boolean[] connections
      There should be one entry for each successful connection mapped to peers[].

      Bytes downloaded so far.
      private java.lang.String event
      Last event in client's activity.

      Name of the file
      private java.lang.String info_hash
      Decoded info hash from the .torrent file.
      private static Bittorrent instance
      Single Bittorrent instance.
      private int left
      Bytes left to download for current file.

      Current list of peers.

      Peers list as per the server's response.

      Number of pieces in this torrent

      Properties file.

      Input stream from server.

      Hard coded .torrent file path.

      Listening server for incoming connections.
      (package private) java.net.ServerSocket ss
      Listener server of the client
      private TorrentInfo torrentInfo
      Decoded .torrent file information.
      private int uploaded
      Bytes uploaded so far.
      private byte[][] verificationArray
      This array stores the correct SHA-1 hashes for each piece of the file this object was instantiated to retrieve.
      private java.io.DataOutputStream writeToServer
      Output stream to server.

      • connectToPeer

        public void connectToPeer(java.lang.String peer)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        For the sake of Project 0, this will connect to the selected peer. Please do not pay attention to the i+1, that's to compensate an i - 1 on the called method.
        Parameters:
        peer - ipAndPort
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
